Operation 'timeOffRequestsAdd' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description is identical to summary and provides no actionable details. Improved version clarifies the operation creates a new resource, specifies expected inputs (employee ID, dates, type), describes the return value (created object with ID), and mentions potential side effects (notifications). This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.summary_suggestion: Create a new employee time off request
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new time off request for an employee. Accepts time off request details including employee ID, start date, end date, and request type. Returns the created time off request object with a unique identifier. The request is stored in the HRIS system and may trigger notifications to managers depending on system configuration.
data.reasoning: Original description is identical to summary and provides no actionable details. Improved version clarifies the operation creates a new resource, specifies expected inputs (employee ID, dates, type), describes the return value (created object with ID), and mentions potential side effects (notifications). This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

message: Operation 'timeOffRequestsOne' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details. Original description lacks specificity about what is returned and what parameters are required. Enhanced version clarifies the retrieval scope (specific request by IDs), describes the returned object structure, and explicitly states required path parameters. This improves AI agent ability to determine when this operation is appropriate and what data will be available.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific employee time off request
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific time off request for an employee by employee ID and request ID. Returns the complete time off request object including status, dates, type, and any associated metadata. Requires valid employee_id and request id parameters in the path.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks specificity about what is returned and what parameters are required. Enhanced version clarifies the retrieval scope (specific request by IDs), describes the returned object structure, and explicitly states required path parameters. This improves AI agent ability to determine when this operation is appropriate and what data will be available.

message: Operation 'timeOffRequestsUpdate' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description is too generic and doesn't explain PATCH behavior or side effects. Improved version clarifies partial update semantics, specifies which fields can be modified, describes the return value, and mentions potential notifications on status changes. This helps AI agents understand the operation's scope and effects.

data.summary_suggestion: Update an existing employee time off request
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing time off request for an employee using PATCH semantics. Accepts partial updates to time off request fields such as status, dates, or type. Returns the updated time off request object. Only provided fields are modified; omitted fields retain their current values. May trigger notifications to relevant parties if status changes.
data.reasoning: Original description is too generic and doesn't explain PATCH behavior or side effects. Improved version clarifies partial update semantics, specifies which fields can be modified, describes the return value, and mentions potential notifications on status changes. This helps AI agents understand the operation's scope and effects.

message: Operation 'timeOffRequestsDelete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description lacks clarity about what happens on deletion and what response is returned. Enhanced version specifies the deletion scope (by IDs), clarifies the HTTP response (204), and warns about potential side effects on related records. This helps AI agents understand the destructive nature of the operation and its implications.

data.summary_suggestion: Delete an employee time off request
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a specific time off request for an employee by employee ID and request ID. Removes the time off request from the HRIS system. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion. This action is permanent and may affect related payroll or scheduling records depending on system configuration.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks clarity about what happens on deletion and what response is returned. Enhanced version specifies the deletion scope (by IDs), clarifies the HTTP response (204), and warns about potential side effects on related records. This helps AI agents understand the destructive nature of the operation and its implications.

Improved version clarifies the operation retrieves a single company record, specifies the return type (HrisCompany object), and indicates the required ID parameter for better AI agent understanding.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information for a specific company by ID. Returns the complete HrisCompany object containing company details such as name, legal entity information, and organizational structure. Requires the company ID as a path parameter.
data.reasoning: Original description is too minimal and doesn't explain what data is returned or what parameters are needed. message: Operation 'companiesUpdate' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description lacks critical details about partial update behavior, input schema, return value, and authentication requirements. Enhanced version clarifies that this is a PATCH operation supporting partial updates, specifies the request and response schemas, and explains the side effect of modifying company data.

data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing company's information using partial updates. Accepts a HrisCompany object with fields to be modified. Only provided fields will be updated; omitted fields remain unchanged. Returns the updated HrisCompany object. Requires the company ID as a path parameter and appropriate authentication headers.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks critical details about partial update behavior, input schema, return value, and authentication requirements. data.current_description: Apideck operates as a stateless Unified API, which means that the list endpoint only provides a portion of the employee model. This is due to the fact that most HRIS systems do not readily provide all data in every call. However, you can access the complete employee model through an employee detail call.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of employees from the HRIS system. Returns a subset of the employee model due to stateless API design and HRIS system limitations. For complete employee details including all fields, use the Get Employee endpoint with a specific employee ID. Supports filtering, sorting, and cursor-based pagination via limit and cursor parameters.
data.reasoning: The current description explains architectural limitations but lacks clarity on what is actually returned and how to use pagination. Added information about pagination support, filtering/sorting capabilities, and clearer guidance on when to use the detail endpoint. Summary improved to indicate pagination support for better AI agent routing.
